basics.name: Amelia Ghanea
basics.label: Neuroscience Student
basics.summary: Final year BSc Neuroscience student at the University of Bristol, preparing undergraduate research on AI in Pharmacovigilance for publication. Recipient of the 2024 Snowdon Master's Scholarship. Member of the Disabled Leaders Network and Windsor Fellowship. Prospective MSc candidate.

education.score: First Class Honours in Year 2 overall and Year 1 Summer Exams

work.name: Elsevier - Global Health Markets
work.summary:
Produced the first Software Development Lifecycle plan for Elsevier’s Health Markets, using Confluence and Jira APIs (React & Node. js) to improve collaboration and communication between 50+ groups, reducing average weekly time spent on admin-related tasks by 58% within the department.
Piloted research into quantifying and mitigating racial and gender bias in the Clinical Key AI tool, implementing a proof-of-concept adapted retrieval-augmented generation system for over a million peer-reviewed medical papers.
